byline.contributor: Steven Erlanger contributed reporting from Brussels.

snippet: The Unesco-Obiang Prize was financed by Teodoro Obiang Nguema Mbasogo, a leader with a brutal reputation who has ruled the tiny state of Equatorial Guinea since a 1979 coup.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization

lead_paragraph: The Unesco-Obiang Prize was financed by Teodoro Obiang Nguema Mbasogo, a leader with a brutal reputation who has ruled the tiny state of Equatorial Guinea since a 1979 coup.

headline.main: Unesco Delays Decision on Fate of Prize Sponsored by Dictator
headline.print_headline: Unesco Vote Will Prolong Prize Dispute
headline.seo: Unesco Delays Decision on Disputed Science Award
